018package org.opengis.parameter;
019
020
021/**
022 * Thrown by {@link ParameterValue} getter methods when a value cannot be casted to the
023 * requested type. For example, this exception is thrown when {@link ParameterValue#doubleValue()}
024 * is invoked but the value is not convertible to a {@code double}.
025 *
026 * <div class="note"><b>Note:</b>
027 * this exception is of kind {@code IllegalStateException} instead of {@code IllegalArgumentException}
028 * because it is not caused by a bad argument. It is rather a consequence of a zero-argument method invoked
029 * in a context where it is not allowed.</div>
030 *
031 * This exception is typically thrown by the following methods:
032 * <ul>
033 *   <li>{@link ParameterValue#intValue()}</li>
034 *   <li>{@link ParameterValue#doubleValue()}</li>
035 *   <li>{@link ParameterValue#booleanValue()}</li>
036 *   <li>{@link ParameterValue#stringValue()}</li>
037 *   <li>{@link ParameterValue#valueFile()}</li>
038 * </ul>
039 *
040 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (IRD, Geomatys)
041 * @version 3.1
042 * @since   1.0
043 *
044 * @see InvalidParameterValueException
045 */
046public class InvalidParameterTypeException extends IllegalStateException {
047    /**
048     * Serial number for inter-operability with different versions.
049     */
050    private static final long serialVersionUID = 2740762597003093176L;
051
052    /**
053     * The invalid parameter name.
054     */
055    private final String parameterName;
056
057    /**
058     * Creates an exception with the specified message and parameter name.
059     *
060     * @param message        the detail message, saved for later retrieval by the {@link #getMessage()} method.
061     * @param parameterName  the parameter name.
062     */
063    public InvalidParameterTypeException(String message, String parameterName) {
064        super(message);
065        this.parameterName = parameterName;
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Creates an exception with the specified message, cause and parameter name.
070     *
071     * @param message        the detail message, saved for later retrieval by the {@link #getMessage()} method.
072     * @param cause          the cause, saved for later retrieval by the {@link #getCause()} method.
073     * @param parameterName  the parameter name.
074     *
075     * @since 3.1
076     */
077    public InvalidParameterTypeException(String message, Throwable cause, String parameterName) {
078        super(message, cause);
079        this.parameterName = parameterName;
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Creates an exception with a default message, the specified cause and parameter name.
084     *
085     * @param cause      the cause, saved for later retrieval by the {@link #getCause()} method.
086     * @param parameter  the parameter from which to get the parameter name.
087     */
088    InvalidParameterTypeException(Throwable cause, String parameterName) {
089        super("Cannot get the â" + parameterName + "â parameter value.", cause);
090        this.parameterName = parameterName;
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * Returns the parameter name.
095     *
096     * @return the parameter name.
097     */
098    public String getParameterName() {
099        return parameterName;
100    }
101}
